text: I bought this bottle in the hipercoop in Kriens. I drank it tonight at home, relax, tired after our slavery work of this sad word of neoliberalism, happy to dream a little, to read Zola or Hannah Arendt and to avoid this poor T.V and happy to drink this beer with a nice sweetness side, giving to me the time to contemplate the nature. The body is like an Irish ale, copper and brown color, normal carbonation, thin and white foam. The taste is well balanced, a bit watery, pleasant side of vanilla, toffee, malty but not bready like a lager, some hop, a bit crispy but the sensation is in the mouth pleasant, next pint please!!!!
Amber with little white head. Aroma is phenols, cinnamon, banana. Taste is a little more sour than expected. Light on the tongue. Ok.
Bottle. Red amber body with tan head. Aroma is malty wood caramel. Taste is sweet malts wood caramel hints of fruits. Aftertaste is sweet malts with some bitterness in the background.
At BKL - Nice reddish color, beige head. Taste is quite sweet, wood notes, red berries. no carbonation. Im not used to this style but it didnt appeal to me on first sight...
UPDATED: FEB 8, 2017 Sweet, smoky and woody. Honey, maple, caramel, mild pine and wood flavours. Overall too sweet and totally lacking bitterness.

Bottle. 
Great woodhoney aroma
Hazy red Amber, offwhite lace
Medium light body
Wooden, light earthy strawberry flavor. Interesting aromatics, a bit flat in the finish.

0.33l bottle from coop in zurich, 7.0% abv. pours a hazy deep amber with a small off-white head. aroma of wood, peat, toffee, leaves, dried fruit. flavour of wood, toffee, dates, leaves, rye bread. flat carbonation. interesting and complex.

Bottle at home. Clear copper red, minimal orange cream head. Rich malty aroma, butterscotch, dates, red wine, oak wood. Carbonated, wood barrel, cream, butterscotch, walnuts, almonds, biscuit, vanilla. Light hoppy bitter ending.
Bottle, thanks Anstei! Amber color. Caramel, soft oak and vinous notes in the aroma. Caramelly vinous flavor with soft sour notes. Low on carbon. Oily, slightly metallic finish. Interesting beer.
Koper kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt zoetig, caramel, vanille, zoetig. Beetje barley wine achtig. Smaakt zoetig, vanille, crème, moutig. Aardige smaak.

Bottle from Coop. Aroma of wood and vanilla indeed, but besides that healthily malt-dominated. Slight caramel, quite dry, slightly sweet taste, crisp carbonation. Herbal. Beautifully balanced, making this unusual beer highly drinkable. nice.

Bottle from Jelmoli, Zurich, Switzerland, consumed at home whilst making Cherry Ice Cream, 3rd July 2016  Red in colour with a little cloudiness and not much head. Very soft in the mouth, some toffee (which tastes cooked) a gentle bitterness, slight chewy edge. I hadnt a clue that this was listed as an Irish Ale and that it was in the top 50 (only my second of these)! A6 A3 T7 P4 Ov15 3.5

Smells of dried apricots. Pours red brown with an off-white, thin quick dissipating head. Malty sherry flavors with low carbonation and a neutral short finish. Balanced and tasty with a little underlying alcohol bite. I like it.

Flaska @ Andorra Bar, Zürich. Klar bärnstensfärgad med ett snyggt smutsvitt skum. Dofter av trä och karamell. Smakinslag av trä, karamell, frukt samt en ton av vanilj. Fyllig kropp sett till procenten. Mjuk munkänsla, fruktig avslutning.

Many thanks to CH-303 for this bottle! The beer starts mild and smooth. Nice red smooth malt with a subtle soft wood in the background. Easy to drink and great, smooth and nice malty. The wood is with the not too sweetish malt in the aftertaste. Nice!

300ml bottle served in a pint glass.
A: Pours a clear dark amber to maple brown color forming a medium thin bubbled head with medium retention that leaves a lot of thin molasses lacings in the glass. 
S: Sweet nose. Strong notes of caramel malts, toffee, oak and maple syrup. Hints of bourbon. Grassy and flowery hops. 
T: Follows the nose. Sweet upfront: Strong notes of caramel malts, toffee, oak and maple syrup. Hints of bourbon. Light hops bitterness. Grassy hops profile. 
M: Medium body and carbonation. Oak, maple syrup,caramel and bourbon in the aftertaste. 
O: Good drinkability. Warming. Strong and very tasty but still a good option to the winter.

Appearance: Dark chestnut brown, clear. Quite a big tan head.
Aroma: Barrel, followed by some malt.
Taste: Medium malt, strong oak/barrel. Slight caramel sweetness.
Bought: Drinks of the World (Online), 330 ml, CHF 5.80
Info: 31/12-2015, BB: 29/2-2016

Small yellow-cream head over red-copper to chestnut beer. Malt, autumnleaves, bit of oxydation, caramel. Sweet caramel; some New World hops, making it herbal in the finish and retronasal. Warming up, and gradually increasing, slight incense flavouring. Medium bodied, quite slick, bit oily feel. The oak aging might be more pronounced, IMO.  Txs to the brewer!

Bottled 330ml. -Trade with CH-303 (thanks Asbjorn!). Clear amber coloured, small to medium sized pale beige head, light caramel in the nose. Toasted malt, strong notes of oak, mild fruity and caramel with hint of vanilla and leather. Interesting but nothing thrilling here.

(bottle) clear deep amber colour with a frothy light-beige head. aroma of paint thinner and black pepper, with lots of liquorice, some canned peaches and bran flakes. flavour is mostly coconut milk, vanilla and pale malts, with lots of alcohol, dill and a touch of starch in the finish. heavy-bodied with fizzy carbonation.

(Flasche) Es hat eine dunkle, kupferne Farbe, ist klar filtriert mit einer weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist süßlich,etwas harzig, leicht metallisch, malzig. Der Geschmack ist prickelnd, süßlich, schlank, leicht adstringent mit einer leichten Dill Note im Rachen.

Ganz klares dunkles Kupferrot. Kurzer Schaum. In der Nase Vanille, Butter, Holz. Zu Beginn Karamell und süß etwas zusammenziehend. Wieder Vanille und etwas Holz, aber durchwegs bleibt das Karamell ist fast zu klebrig. Mittelvoll, das Mundgefühl komisch, leicht sprudelnd wegen der Kohlensäure. Der Abgang bleibt er auf der süßen Seite der Bitterkeit.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ruby color with beige foam head. The smell is almost exclusively vanilla and not really noteworthy. The taste is primarily round and sweet. The typical barrel rounded taste with following woody vanilla sweetness and slightly hoppy bitterness. Very well performed beer with little more than the obvious tastes, still easy and pleasant to drink.
Braun, orange amber. In der Nase Eiche, Vanille, Wiennoten, Malz. Am Gaumen Frucht, Vanille, Holz.
Rötlichbraunes Bier mit einer ordentlichen weißen Schaumkrone. Geruch holzig, Vanille, fruchtig. Geschmack süß holzig, sehr mild und weich, Vanille, reife Früchte, sehr gelungen!

Belle couleur cuivrée foncée et transparente, mousse pauvre. Arôme assez fort et très bon ! Notes de mélasse, vanille, poivre et bois, assez sucré. Saveur moyennement intense, vanillé, boisé, poivré, mélassé et poivré. Léquilibre est plus penché sur le doux. Jaime bien. Le corps est plein et crémeux, la carbonation est légère, la finale est moyennement persistante. Très bonne à boire en hiver !

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2014 Deep ruby color with small head. Vanilla, honey and oak in the aroma. A bit hoppy as well, but very sweet. Sweet malts and a nice oak taste. Smooth mouthfeel, and slight bitterness, but very balanced between bitterness and sweetness. A good one.

bouteille 33cl
La mousse est beige et disparait vite. Couleur brun clair avec des reflets rouges. Arômes de pommes, de bois et de vanille.
Goût très sucré qui reste en bouche longtemps. Amertume faible. Légèrement aqueuse.

Der Schaum ist hellocker farbend! 
Herber parfümierter Geschmack zu beginn. 
Man schmeck das Holzfass. 
Eher leicht sauer und bitter im Abgang.
Kupferfarben, der Schaum fällt schnell in sich zusammen. Der Geschmack bleibt etwas hinter den interessanten Malz- und Holz- und Pilzaromen zurück; etwas flach, Bitterkaramellnoten.

pours a deep reddish amber with a qickly dissipating head; lovely oak aroma, with hints of dark fruit, creme brulee and vanilla; nice onset of taste, appropriate carbonation, oaky caramel notes, with sherry-like alcohol not well hidden, watery finish, but delicate bitterness. All in all really nice.

Bottle, pours amber with small frothy head. Sweet hoppy taste with fruity palate. Medium dry finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle.
Clear golden colored with a small white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of hops, oak and vanilla.
Sweet and fruity flavor of hops, caramel and vanilla with notes of oak.
Sweet finish of oak.

Aroma: butter, caramel, resin; Appearance: hazy orange and brown, minimal head; Taste: medium bitterness, slight sweetness, slight sourness; Palate: medium carbonation, oily texture, abrupt finish

Delicious ale, lacking intense sourness often towering over other oak ales. If Doppelbock is liquid bread, this beer will be the liquid croissant.

Clear reddish brown color with a small offwhite head, good lasting and lacing - Aroma is woody, caramel, malty, vanilla, hints of dried fruits - flavor is woody, malty and vanilla - Medium body, light/medium bitterness, sweet, sweet woody malty finish - good and interesting but lake of malt body

Aroma: wooden malts, massive oak flavours. Appearance: dark clear amber, hardly any head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: oaky flavours, strong sweet caramel matos. Overall: interesting Irish Ale, maybe a but too oaky. Bottle from Drinks of the World, Zurich.

from Erzbierschof - hazy reddish-brown beer with a poor head retention; fairly woody with notes of red fruits marmalade, hints of vanilla; pretty astringent, a good malt body, harsh, dry and corny, pretty bitter and woody finish with more fruity notes

Bottled 33cl. Purchased in Drinks of the World. Smallish head. Some boletus in the nose. A lot going on flavorwise. Oak components throughout. Some residual sugars in the finish which is mainly reminiscent of caramel.

Geschenk von Züri -- 33cl Flasche -- Klares Amber mit Rotstich, feiner bräunlicher Schaum. Nase verhalten aber sauber nach Caramel. Zunge weiche vanilleartige Holztöne, sonst ausgewogenes Süsse/Säure/bitter-Spiel, weiche Rezens, frisch, gut trinkbar. Nicht der ganz grosse Wurf aber fehlerlos und unkompliziert.
Bitter würziger Antrunk mit süßer Holzigkeit. Gleichzeitig aber wässrig, geringe Intensität im Hintergrund. Eine merkwürdige und nicht harmonische Kombination. 8/7/6/7/10/7
